title: Active-duty Boston police officer dies after more than 30 years with department, BPD says
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Officer Scott MacIsaac, a Boston police officer, died of cancer on Friday after serving since 1995.
MacIsaac worked in several districts and was most recently assigned to West Roxbury for 6 years.
He was recognized for commendable actions including during the Boston Marathon bombings and lifesaving incidents.

title: Bruins’ Jeremy Swayman gets into goalie fight with Andrei Vasilevskiy in outdoor game
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman and Andrei Vasilevskiy engaged in a rare goalie fight during the Bruins' outdoor game against the Lightning.
The fight occurred at Raymond James Stadium with over 64,000 fans attending during a 6-5 shootout loss for Boston.
Both goalies received five-minute fighting penalties but remained in the game, with Swayman recording 41 saves.

title: Suspect charged with murder after mother and son shot to death in Fall River
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Arlington Cole, 54, charged with two counts of murder and unlawful firearm possession in Fall River shooting.
Elizabeth Almeida, 54, and her son Nicholas Almeida, 25, were found shot on Barnes Street Friday night.
Cole, who was dating Elizabeth Almeida, is set to be arraigned on Monday, according to the DA's office.

title: Dozens rescued by N.H. fire officials after ski lift malfunctions in bitter cold
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Nearly 60 skiers were rescued by fire officials from a malfunctioning ski lift at Dartmouth Skiway, NH.
Fire departments from Lyme, Hanover, and Thetford evacuated 59 people in under 90 minutes before dark.
One skier was hospitalized, while others were checked for injuries and returned to the main lodge.

title: Former Mass. state senator receives more prison time for fraud
author: Carson Lyle
bullets: Former Mass. State Sen. Dean Tran sentenced to 11 additional months for obstructing justice and making false statements.
Tran previously sentenced to 18 months for pandemic unemployment fraud and omitting income on tax returns.
Tran's legal issues include charges of ethics violations and stealing firearms from an elderly constituent.

title: Bruins’ Fraser Minten named NHL Rookie of the Month
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Fraser Minten named NHL Rookie of the Month for January after scoring eight goals in 14 games.
Minten played a crucial role in the Bruins' 11-2-1 record, leading rookies with 14 points last month.
Minten joined Bruins from Maple Leafs in 2025; the team faces the Lightning with young centers on Sunday.

title: 7 people are presumed dead after their Gloucester fishing boat sank. Here’s how they’ll be remembered.
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Seven crew members of the Lily Jean are presumed dead after their boat sank off Gloucester's coast.
The U.S. Coast Guard suspended search operations after covering 1,000 square miles without finding survivors.
Captain Gus Sanfilippo and other crew members are being mourned by families; investigations into the sinking continue.

title: Bruins dress as colonial Patriots ahead of Stadium Series game in Tampa
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Boston Bruins players dressed as colonial-era Patriots for their Stadium Series game against the Tampa Bay Lightning.
The costumes were sourced from Boston Costume, allowing players to design their own unique historical outfits.
The Lightning wore Tampa Bay Buccaneers-themed uniforms as both teams embraced their locations for the game.

title: Red Sox reportedly trade pitcher Jordan Hicks to White Sox
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: Red Sox trade pitcher Jordan Hicks and prospect David Sandlin to White Sox, reports ESPN's Jeff Passan.
Boston receives minor league pitcher Gage Ziehl from Chicago and sends cash in the trade.
The trade involves a salary move as Hicks is set to earn $12.5 million in 2026.

title: Photos: Something in the Way music fest at Roadrunner, Day 1
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: The Something in the Way festival featured performances from indie bands like The Hotelier and Tigers Jaw at Roadrunner, Boston.
Photographer Ben Stas captured images of the event for Boston.com, showcasing bands such as Explosions in the Sky and Angel Du$t.
The two-day festival includes diverse acts from emo to screamo, with live updates provided by Boston.com journalist Darin Zullo.
